2000.context: Broadcom Inc. is a semiconductor and infrastructure software conglomerate focused on semiconductors, networking, storage, and enterprise software. Broadband and networking chip leader. Cable modems and set-top boxes.

competitors.name: Texas Instruments
competitors.notes: Major semiconductor company competing in DSP and communications chips

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Dominant chip maker with networking and communications products

competitors.name: Conexant
competitors.notes: Spin-off from Rockwell focused on communications semiconductors

competitors.name: Analog Devices
competitors.notes: Semiconductor company competing in signal processing and communications

competitors.name: Applied Micro Circuits
competitors.notes: Fabless semiconductor company in networking and communications

competitors.name: PMC-Sierra
competitors.notes: Semiconductor solutions for networking and communications

competitors.name: Vitesse Semiconductor
competitors.notes: Networking and communications ICs competitor

competitors.name: Marvell Technology
competitors.notes: Fabless semiconductor company in storage and communications

2005.context: Broadcom Inc. is a semiconductor and infrastructure software conglomerate focused on semiconductors, networking, storage, and enterprise software. Expanded into mobile and wireless connectivity chips.

competitors.name: Qualcomm

competitors.name: Texas Instruments

competitors.name: Agere Systems

competitors.name: Silicon Laboratories

competitors.name: Conexant
competitors.notes: Broadband and communications semiconductor provider

2010.context: Broadcom Inc. is a semiconductor and infrastructure software conglomerate focused on semiconductors, networking, storage, and enterprise software. Network switching and wireless infrastructure. Data center growth.

competitors.name: Qualcomm
competitors.notes: Leading competitor in wireless/mobile semiconductors, particularly in wireless modems and mobile processors

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Competed in networking chips, Ethernet controllers, and network interface cards

competitors.name: Texas Instruments
competitors.notes: Competitor in wireless solutions and analog/digital chips for various industries

competitors.name: Marvell Technology
competitors.notes: Direct competitor in networking, storage, and wireless semiconductor solutions

competitors.name: Analog Devices
competitors.notes: Competitor in semiconductor solutions for communications and industrial applications

competitors.name: NXP Semiconductors
competitors.notes: Competed in connectivity solutions and wireless communications

competitors.name: Cisco
competitors.notes: Competed as a customer and competitor in networking infrastructure and chips

2015.context: Broadcom Inc. is a semiconductor and infrastructure software conglomerate focused on semiconductors, networking, storage, and enterprise software. Acquired Brocade. Enterprise storage and networking focus.

competitors.name: Qualcomm
competitors.notes: Fierce competitor in wireless solutions, particularly in mobile phone processors and wireless modems

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Competitor in data center networking solutions, processors, and connectivity technologies

competitors.name: Marvell Technology
competitors.notes: Direct competitor in networking, storage, and wireless semiconductor solutions

competitors.name: Texas Instruments
competitors.notes: Competed in wireless, industrial, and analog semiconductor solutions

competitors.name: NXP Semiconductors
competitors.notes: Competitor in automotive semiconductors, connectivity solutions, and general-purpose microcontrollers

competitors.name: Mellanox (pre-Nvidia acquisition)
competitors.notes: Major competitor in high-speed networking, particularly InfiniBand and Ethernet adapters

competitors.name: Samsung Semiconductor
competitors.notes: Competed in DRAM, SSDs, processors, and various semiconductor solutions

2020.context: Broadcom Inc. is a semiconductor and infrastructure software conglomerate focused on semiconductors, networking, storage, and enterprise software. Acquired Symantec enterprise security. Infrastructure software expansion.

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Semiconductor competitor in data center solutions, networking, and integrated graphics

competitors.name: Qualcomm
competitors.notes: Direct competitor in wireless communication technologies and mobile/IoT markets

competitors.name: Nvidia
competitors.notes: Semiconductor competitor in AI and graphics processing, posing competitive threat to Broadcom's offerings

competitors.name: AMD
competitors.notes: Competitor in semiconductor solutions for data centers and computing

competitors.name: Texas Instruments
competitors.notes: Competitor in analog and embedded processing semiconductors

competitors.name: Marvell Technology
competitors.notes: Competitor in networking and storage semiconductor solutions

competitors.name: Micron
competitors.notes: Competitor in memory and storage semiconductor solutions

competitors.name: Cisco
competitors.notes: Competitor in networking infrastructure and solutions

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Enterprise software competitor following Broadcom's CA Technologies and Symantec acquisitions

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Enterprise software competitor in cybersecurity, automation, and infrastructure software

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Growing competitor in enterprise software and cloud solutions

2024.context: Broadcom Inc. is a semiconductor and infrastructure software conglomerate focused on semiconductors, networking, storage, and enterprise software. Completed $61B VMware acquisition. Major enterprise software player.

competitors.name: Nvidia
competitors.notes: Primary AI semiconductor competitor, dominates general-purpose AI GPUs while Broadcom leads in custom AI ASICs

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Semiconductor competitor in data center solutions, CPUs, networking chips, and Ethernet controllers

competitors.name: Qualcomm
competitors.notes: Competitor in wireless communication technologies, mobile processors, and specialized semiconductors

competitors.name: AMD
competitors.notes: Semiconductor competitor in AI chips, data center processors, and GPUs

competitors.name: Marvell Technology
competitors.notes: Competitor in data center networking, custom silicon, and storage solutions

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Enterprise software competitor in cloud infrastructure, databases, and enterprise applications

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Enterprise software competitor with extensive portfolio in cybersecurity, automation, and enterprise services

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Major enterprise software competitor in virtualization, cloud platforms (Azure), and enterprise solutions

competitors.name: Nutanix
competitors.notes: Direct VMware alternative in hyperconverged infrastructure and virtualization, benefiting from VMware customer concerns

competitors.name: Cisco
competitors.notes: Competitor in networking infrastructure, both as customer and competitor

competitors.name: Texas Instruments
competitors.notes: Semiconductor competitor in analog and embedded processing

competitors.name: Micron
competitors.notes: Competitor in memory and storage solutions

2025.context: Broadcom Inc. is a semiconductor and infrastructure software conglomerate focused on semiconductors, networking, storage, and enterprise software. VMware integration driving software revenue. AI networking and custom chips.

competitors.name: Nvidia
competitors.notes: Dominant competitor in general-purpose AI GPUs; Broadcom differentiates with custom AI ASICs that are task-specific and more energy efficient

competitors.name: AMD
competitors.notes: Major AI and data center competitor; stock up 70% in 2025 vs Broadcom's 45% gain; trades at similar P/E multiples (AMD 32x vs AVGO 33.5x)

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Semiconductor competitor in data center, networking, and connectivity solutions, though Broadcom leads in networking chips

competitors.name: Marvell Technology
competitors.notes: Direct competitor in custom AI chips, data center networking, and infrastructure semiconductors

competitors.name: Qualcomm
competitors.notes: Competitor in wireless communications and mobile semiconductors

competitors.name: Nutanix
competitors.notes: Critical VMware alternative gaining traction as customers seek alternatives due to Broadcom's VMware pricing changes

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Enterprise software competitor in virtualization (Hyper-V), cloud infrastructure (Azure), and enterprise solutions

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Enterprise software competitor in cloud infrastructure, databases, and enterprise applications

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Competitor in enterprise software, infrastructure, cybersecurity, and enterprise services

competitors.name: Texas Instruments
competitors.notes: Semiconductor competitor in analog and embedded processing

competitors.name: Cisco
competitors.notes: Networking infrastructure competitor and customer
